title: From earrings to tiles – what you can do with plastic waste
description: How people around the world are recycling plastic waste themselves and turning it into cool stuff.

title: How the world's oldest hat shop made it through lockdown
description: Lock & Co was first established in 1676 and has sold hats to the likes of Nelson and Winston Churchill.

title: VR helps Indians and Pakistanis visit their lost homes
description: Indians and Pakistanis who fled their homes during partition can now revisit their childhood - virtually.

title: How to keep your cool when the office heats up
description: Buildings that are too hot are bad for your health and productivity but simple measures can help.

title: How losing his sight spurred cyclist Steve Bate to the Paralympics
description: Steve Bate was told he could be blind within four years - now he's defending his Paralympic title.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: A 'different' Games but Paralympians still hope to shine
description: The opening ceremony of the Tokyo Paralympics takes place on Tuesday with the Japanese capital still facing Covid-19 challenges.

title: Kabul arrivals in the UK: 'We are the lucky ones'
description: UK troops are evacuating British nationals and eligible Afghans. Here are some of their stories.

title: Mission: Impossible request leads to Hollywood encounter
description: A request for an unnamed VIP to land in a garden leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.

title: 'Toby will be a better person after Love Island'
description: Lewis Preston runs the finalist's social media accounts and thinks he'll cope with any negativity.

title: Covid returns to top 10 causes of death
description: Covid-19 was the ninth biggest cause of death in England in July.

title: Afghanistan: Foreign troops extension 'a clear violation' - Taliban

title: Hours without food or water in Kabul airport 'hell'

title: Universal credit: Labour promises shake-up to benefit
description: The party says it would allow low income workers on universal credit to keep more of their take-home pay.

title: Gogglebox star Mary Cook dies aged 92
description: She was known for her appearances with friend Marina Wingrove on the Channel 4 show.

title: Simmonds and Stubbs to carry GB flag at Tokyo Paralympics opening ceremony
description: Swimmer Ellie Simmonds and archer John Stubbs will carry the GB flag at Tuesday's Tokyo Paralympics opening ceremony.

description: Swimmer Ellie Simmonds and archer John Stubbs will carry the GB flag at Tuesday's Tokyo Paralympics opening ceremony.

title: Anti-Taliban resistance group says it has thousands of fighters
description: The group says it wants to pursue peace, but if that fails it claims to have thousands of fighters ready.

title: John Lydon loses court battle to stop Sex Pistols songs being used in a new TV series
description: The band's former frontman had objected to songs being used in a new Danny Boyle-directed TV drama.

title: Wood out of third Test against India with shoulder injury
description: England bowler Mark Wood is out of the third Test against India because of a shoulder injury.

title: Covid: Government warns Covid test firms over misleading prices

description: The government says it has met its target to offer all 16 and 17-year-olds in England a vaccine.

description: England's Georgia Hall, Charley Hull and Mel Reid are all in Europe's team for their defence of the Solheim Cup against the United States in September.

title: RMT threatens strike action over legionella on trains
description: The RMT has launched a dispute after trace amounts of legionella were found in four trains' toilets.

title: Snowdon: Call to respect mountain amid spike in visitors
description: Litter, erosion and traffic put "significant pressure" on the mountain, says the Snowdonia Society.

title: Murray beats lucky loser Rubin after Kyrgios withdraws
description: Britain's Andy Murray beats American lucky loser Noah Rubin in the Winston-Salem Open first round after his scheduled opponent Nick Kyrgios withdraws.

title: Newspaper headlines: PM delay plea to Biden and UK evacuation steps up
